title: Disconnecting from servers while in champion select
body:
Recently, my client has been randomly disconnecting me from the pvp.net servers ONLY while in champion select. I have no idea what is causing this, or how i can prevent it. I've used the hextech repair tool numerous times and i simply can't tell what's going on. This is especially a nuisance when i am trying to play ranked. I would join the lobby, and at times when other people are selecting their champion, it does not update. This just results in the timer sitting at zero. https://gyazo.com/14f451e73ad9a6c3064ea85b2c2918ac
In the screenshot you can see the chatroom and it shows everyone leaving the room. At that point on my screen our third player was banning but for everyone else, I had to lock in my champion and this glitch or random disconnection caused me to dodge the match unintentionally. This has happened before and i've lost LP here and there for it happening.

If anyone has info or something that may be able to help i'd greatly appreciate it. Trying to avoid losses in provisionals, placements, LP, and avoiding the "dodge" punishments.

replies.body:
PvP.net is a pretty important service in the League Client, as you've seen by the disconnections occurring when you've disconnected from it. Typically when you're continuously disconnecting from this service, it means your connection to this server is *unstable* due to a local or routing issue with your network. To deal with this, I suggest working through the steps in our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) so we can confirm your local settings are okay.

Let me know if this issue still pops up after taking those steps.
